alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 7:11PM EDT until July 04 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 711 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Haverhill, or 18 miles southwest of Littleton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Haverhill, Franconia, Piermont, Woodstock, Lisbon, Bath, Benton, Easton, Warren, Landaff and Sugar Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
